titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dachine Rainer Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 06:02

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection documents the life and work of poet and author Dachine Rainer (pseudonym of Sylvia Newman) and her relationships with other literary figures, particularly Rebecca West. Material includes correspondence, writings, personal papers, photographs, printed material, and a computer disk.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bernard Quaritch Ltd. on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 41 (computer disk): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 42 (correspondence): Restricted until 2060. For further information consult appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Dachine Rainer Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dachine Rainer Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, at the time of acquisition. Further organization and description was carried out in 2012.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Dachine Rainer (1921-2000)
bioghist.p: Dachine Rainer, American-born poet, author, and anarchist. Rainer was born Sylvia Newman in New York on January 13, 1921, and studied English literature at Hunter College. Her published works include: poems, essays, and articles in periodicals such as The New Republic and The Nation; and the books The Uncomfortable Inn (1960) and Giornale de Venezia (1996). Rainer befriended Rebecca West after moving to London in 1961. She died on August 19, 2000 and is buried in Highgate Cemetery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the life and work of poet and author Dachine Rainer (pseudonym of Sylvia Newman) and her relationships with other literary figures, particularly Rebecca West. Material includes correspondence, writings, personal papers, photographs, printed material, and a computer disk.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1930-2000. II. Rebecca West Material, 1913-1996. III. Writings, 1936-1996. IV. Personal and Other Papers, 1938-2000.

did.unittitle: Rainer's correspondence regarding Rebecca West to publishers and newspapers, outlines for the Rebecca West Reader, Kitty West, Hetty Muirhead
"In Search of Rebecca West's Harry," copy of typescript
"This Happens Down Our Way All the Time"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript poem by West with revisions. Photocopy of the title page from "Oh Heaven and Poems Written On Active Service" by Ford Hueffer with inscriptions.

did.unittitle: "Dame Rebecca West-Disturber of the Peace," typescript, corrected
Articles on Rebecca West by Rainer that appeared in The New Republic , Manchester Guardian , Commonwealth , Spectator , and Sunday Telegram , printed versions
Drafts and corrected manuscripts on West by Rainer
Reviews and articles written by Rebecca West, clippings
Reviews and interviews of Rebecca West, clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clippings, notes, articles and the order of service for West's funeral at St.Martin-in-the-Field

did.unittitle: "The Fragile Idyll" (also called "L'Escargot"), original manuscript, photocopies with corrections, carbons, typescripts, drafts, notes, correspondence, and related material
"In Search of Rebecca West's Harry," autograph manuscript and copy
"For The Three Of Us," typescript, corrected
"No Thanks," typescripts, photocopies, notes, related material, and correspondence

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Computer disks are restricted. Copies of electronic files may be requested through Access Services: Disk #2001.ycal.0313-g, "BOOK.DOC. PART2.DOC. PART3.DOC"

"The Will of Mitt," final typescript, pages 1-50 missing
"Giornale di Venezia," galleys, notes, corrected manuscript, reviews, and correspondence
"Tom Keating and the Art Establishment," manuscript, corrected, clippings, notes, photographs, and correspondence
"Ballet," manuscript, corrected, notes, photographs, and correspondence
Anti-War, manuscript, clippings, notes, and correspondence
Selected Poems, typescripts, notes, and correspondence
"Ripeness Is All," manuscript, photocopies, and notes
The Early Poems, handwritten and typed poetry with related correspondence
"Loves Delights and Lamentations," edited typescript and photocopies
"Cambridge and Vienna," manuscript, with other writings
"Anarchism: Recent Thoughts," manuscript, notes and correspondence
"Double Agent," manuscript, newspapers and corrected typescript
"Conversations With My Dog," manuscript, edited typescript and notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes published reviews by Rainer that appeared in various magazines and correspondence with editors

did.unittitle: "The Story Of An Infatuation," typescript, carbon copy
E. E. Cummings, notes, writings, correspondence, and related material about the poet
The Artist Bonnington, notes, letters, rewrites, and synopsis

Poems, short stories, notes, and related material
Poems, short stories, notes, and related material
Hunter College essays and school papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letters to police, private investigators, British Parliament, local government agencies, newspapers, tradesmen, utility companies and chemical laboratories.
